thread.title: SHAPE wins battle of Belgium, clinches playoff spot
thread.title_full: SHAPE wins battle of Belgium, clinches playoff spot

title: SHAPE wins battle of Belgium, clinches playoff spot
text:
SHAPE wins battle of Belgium, clinches playoff spot SHAPE page 
BRUSSELS, Belgium -- The SHAPE Spartans clinched their spot in the DODDS-Europe Division II playoffs Friday with a 36-12 defeat of International School of Brussels. 
SHAPE ramped up its offense in the second half to put away a Raider squad that pulled within three points in the third quarter. 
Marten Pardo caught five passes for 107 yards, while Filip Havlena carried 20 times for 55 yards and a touchdown for ISB. 
Trey Kirklen racked up 221 yards and three touchdowns on 25 carries for SHAPE. Noah Parker found Isaac Yunevich for a 59-yard touchdown pass that staked SHAPE to a 13-0 first-half lead. 
ISB also qualified for the playoffs thanks to Vicenza's loss to Hohenfels on Saturday. Join the conversation and share your voice. 
Show Comments
